intro: Encyclia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented orchid, is a species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-green flowers with a distinctive white lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette, aiding in water retention. Encyclia suaveolens is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its delicate, aromatic blooms.
